intro: Paris polyphylla f. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved white adder's tongue, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its striking white flowers that resemble a snake's tongue. The plant features broad, lance-shaped leaves and grows in moist, shaded environments. It is often found in alpine and subalpine regions at high altitudes. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
